title: 104_hr2315
content: The Act titled "Termination of Energy and Natural Resource Tax Subsidies Act of 1995" repeals the expensing of intangible drilling and development costs and mining exploration and development costs. The Act repeals deductions for intangible drilling and development costs, development expenditures, and exploration expenditures under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Conforming amendments are also made to related sections of the Code. The Act repeals deductions for intangible drilling and development costs, development expenditures, and exploration expenditures under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code, including changes to section 59(e)(5), section 193(c), and section 263(a). The Act makes amendments to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changes to section 263, 263A, 291, and 312. The Termination of Energy and Natural Resource Tax Subsidies Act of 1995 made amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changes to section 263, 263A, 291, and 312. The amendments in this section apply to amounts paid or incurred in taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3 and SEC. 4 of the Termination of Energy and Natural Resource Tax Subsidies Act of 1995 repeal percentage depletion and exception from passive loss rules for working interests in oil and gas property for taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. The Termination of Energy and Natural Resource Tax Subsidies Act of 1995 repeals various tax benefits related to energy production, including the credit for producing fuel from nonconventional sources and tax benefits for alcohol fuels. These changes apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. The Termination of Energy and Natural Resource Tax Subsidies Act of 1995 repeals the Alcohol Fuels Credit under Section 40 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, along with other related provisions. The table of sections in the Internal Revenue Code is amended by removing items related to sections 40, 87, and various fuel tax rates. These amendments will apply to taxable years after the enactment of the Act. Section 4041 and 6427 of the Internal Revenue Code are amended by removing specific subsections and paragraphs. These changes will affect the tax regulations for future taxable years. The Internal Revenue Code is being amended to remove specific subsections and paragraphs related to tax regulations for future taxable years. Additionally, amendments are made to sections 9502 and 9503, including the payment of claims with interest if not paid within 20 days. The Internal Revenue Code is being amended to remove specific subsections and paragraphs related to tax regulations for future taxable years. The amendments made by this subsection shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
